column4: can any one tell me how to access local directory from a ssh prompt
precede the command with an l typically
is tht a pipe symbol
an L
for example, a local directory listing is lls, a local cd is lcd
like lls ?
but it says command not found
you are connected via ssh?
yea .... i have used Secure Shell 3.3.9 for windows
I assumed you were using ssh in Linux/Unix...
any thing similar to that when accessing from windows ??
You know what? I was thinking of sftp...
why do you need to issue local commands in ssh?
for file transfer ...... i am logged into the remote machine now using " ssh user@remotemachine"
Secure Shell is specifically for logging into and executing commands on a remote machine and will only work as such
ohh wouldn't scp help ???
yea i agree sftp is a better option i just wanted to know if there are commands for file transfer when in an ssh prompt
ssh provides scp
but how do i use scp when i am logged into a remote system
you might try either link: http://www.eos.ncsu.edu/remoteaccess/man/scp.html  http://help.ischool.washington.edu/faqs/30_32_en.html
can u tell me how to specify the localhost ..... is it "scp filename localhost@ipaddress"
Did you look at the second link? You shouldn't need to specify localhost...
the second link says hostA but in my case hostA is a localhost
in the example, host A is where you are copying files to...
